  physical_appearance: This is a gold belt with a gold buckle. The overall decorative scheme is an interplay of stylised ribbons where some strands have been chased to give an added texture to the item.

  subject_terms_1: stylization belt buckles

  subject_terms_2: Palembang (Indonesia) Straits Settlements Belts (Clothing)

  subject_terms_3: Decorative arts

  sgcool_label_text: The buckle of the gold belt features a dynamic interplay of stylised ribbons
 some of which are lightly chased to give the effect of depth and texture. This Art Deco pattern is repeated in the smaller plaques of pierced gold. Several markings can be found on the back : Dun jing ( or pound gold)
 
 
 and ‘HP’. While belts with multiple panels were popular in the Straits Settlements at the beginning of the 20th century
 the style could be traced to the courts of Palembang.

metadata.physical_appearance: This is a gold belt with a gold buckle. The overall decorative scheme is an interplay of stylised ribbons where some strands have been chased to give an added texture to the item.
metadata.sgcool_label_text: The buckle of the gold belt features a dynamic interplay of stylised ribbons, some of which are lightly chased to give the effect of depth and texture. This Art Deco pattern is repeated in the smaller plaques of pierced gold. Several markings can be found on the back : Dun jing ( or pound gold), , , and ‘HP’. While belts with multiple panels were popular in the Straits Settlements at the beginning of the 20th century, the style could be traced to the courts of Palembang.
